text.title: how I prevent acne & get glowy skin (SKINCARE ROUTINE)
text.p: [Music]
good morning guys it's Sid and welcome
back to those of you guys who have
watched me over the years you would
probably know how much I love skincare
I've done a few skincare videos over the
years but I recently realized I haven't
done one in probably like 2 years now
I've had such
a I'm sorry I've had such a skincare
Journey over the years and I found what
works for me and what doesn't what works
for one person isn't going to work for
the other personally I have extremely
sensitive skin so if you have sensitive
skin these products have been really
great for me I decided I would show my
morning and nighttime skare routine so
grab a little snack put on a face mask
and let's do some
skincare first step is washing oh also I
should say this isn't sponsored first
step of course non-negotiable in the
morning is to wash my face I think I'm
on my third or fourth bottle this is the
mara badescu gentle foaming cleanser I
feel like people don't talk about Mario
badescu enough they're pretty
inexpensive and their products are just
very clean they don't have any strong
scents I need to put my hair up for
[Music]
this this is going to sound like common
sense but it's to make sure you're not
using a dirty towel to dry your face in
the past I just like wouldn't think
about that stuff and I'd use like my
normal hand towel that everyone uses
which is actually kind of gross and then
I thought about all the bacteria that's
on there and now I try to use like a
wash cloth or this is like a clean towel
that I just got my eyelash lift you guys
has faded which is very sad and the
reason I'm saying this is because that
means I've been wearing mascara more
since the eyelash tint lift is gone
whenever I wake up in the morning no
matter how much I try to get it off the
night before I always have just a little
bit of mascara residue under my eyes so
I'll just take some my cellar water this
Garnier one is my go-to if you couldn't
tell I really need a new one I just take
it on a cotton round and quickly go
under and around my
[Music]
eyes I'm actually super fortunate that
I've never really struggled too much
with acne but there was a period a
couple years ago where I was getting so
many breakouts around my chin and nose
area and I swear it's because I was just
using too many products by too many I
mean I was using like 15 layers of
things and I think when you use too much
like that it's just counterproductive
and it really just like clogs your face
now I have like a fiveish step routine
which I think is a lot more reasonable
next I'm going to go in and use some
exfoliator this is the Paul's Choice
exfoliant I'm actually using this with
my hands because I saw someone do that
and I don't know if it's like any better
better but I've just been doing it that
way I actually remember I got a facial
about 3 or 4 years ago and the girl who
did my facial noticed how clogged my
pores wor because that's definitely my
biggest skin concern I would say I tend
to get a lot of blackheads especially
around my nose she was doing a ton of
extractions and she said that I should
be using an exfoliant and that's really
helped with my blackheads and then I
posted a skincare video like a couple
years ago and I remember one of you guys
commented that I shouldn't be using a
granular exfoliant because it can be a
bit tougher harsher and damaging to the
skin and that I should be using a liquid
exfoliant so since then I've been trying
to use more liquid exfoliants and that's
how I found this one I got this from
Sephora as much as you guys think I help
you I think it's reverse you guys help
me even more after a couple minutes of
letting that set I go in with a serum
specifically a serum that's going to
prep my skin for moisturizer I wanted to
show you guys two because I love this
Clarens one so much this is the double
serum age control concentrate I would
definitely really recommend this but if
you're looking for a less expensive
option the Sephora hydrating Serum is
also a really good option and I feel
like people really sleep on Sephora
collection I really like their stuff and
it's a great alternative for some of the
more expensive products I do like to
have a little bit of water on my skin
before putting this on essentially
hyaluronic acid is what preps your skin
the best for moisturizer so that way
your skin can effectively absorb all of
the moisturizer you're using
[Music]
so once that's on I'm going to go in
with a little bit of moisturizer I just
ran out of my drunk elephant one I think
I just threw it away yeah it's in the
trash since I ran out of that one I've
been using this one by Lan this is the
water Bank Blue hyaluronic gel
moisturizer this one's also really great
it has an interesting texture to it and
it feels like almost like water on your
skin
[Music]
something I also learned guys is you
kind of have to be a little patient in
the past I would just keep immediately
applying products to my face but you
need to give your skin like a couple
minutes at least to just absorb the
product before layering more stuff on at
least from my experience usually when I
let something like this sit for a little
bit I'll do my hair or maybe I'll like
get dressed for the day also don't
forget your neck because I forget my
neck like all the time
[Music]
time I'm going to put on a little bit of
eye cream this is the Clarence Total Eye
Lift undry
cream the last step before I would start
my makeup is sunscreen I just had to
talk about this because of everything
this is definitely the most important
step long term I used to hate the
feeling of face sunscreen so much like
if you hate that I understand but super
grop is my absolute favorite face
sunscreen I like their glow screen if I
want a glowy dewy look but for today I
just wanted to kind of keep it more mat
this is their unseen sunscreen and it's
SPF 40 so definitely really good
coverage and I promise it looks like you
have nothing on your skin like just
watch that's it one of my friends
actually 3 years ago sat me down she was
like Sydney I'm 5 years older than you
and the best advice I can give you is to
use face sunscreen and I was like I
don't like sunscreen though I don't like
that like white cast on my face and she
showed me this and ever since then I've
been using it so she influenced me okay
actually last step I almost forgot a
little lip product for the day I mean I
do apply lip product like every 2
minutes so this one I'm using right now
is the Lan vanilla balm that's it that's
my base skin care for the day I've said
this before but I really do think the
extra time that you spend on skincare in
the morning is what can really make your
makeup just lay so much better I'm going
to get ready to do my makeup and stuff
but I'll see you guys tonight for my
nightly skin
care okay guys so I'm getting ready for
bed now can we just take can we just
take a second for my bathroom
guys wow so magical in here like I do
want to shower with that it's a Saturday
night by the way which there's just
something about doing self-care on a
Saturday night when I hear everyone
outside partying for a second I was sad
I'm not going to lie but then I realized
actually no every time I'm out I just
wish I was in my bed I'm taking off my
makeup to start I I'm using this my
cellar water though because I ran out of
the Garnier
one what I'm about to say might seem
like common sense and it's to wash your
face even after taking off your makeup
I'm sure most of you guys probably
already do this but they call it like
double cleansing basically it's just so
that whatever you don't get off with
your makeup remover you ideally do get
off with the cleanser of course you
don't want to have any bacteria on your
face when you sleep so I'm going in
again with the Mario badescu face wash I
used
[Music]
earlier pretty much every night if not
every other night I like to try to use
some retinol before bed retinol is
really good for your skin because it
boosts it's the production of natural
collagen they say to not use it in the
morning because using this can make your
skin really sensitive to the sun that's
why I'd like to use it at night before
bed this is the retinol I've been using
from drunk elephant kind of looks like
mustard but it's really
good I definitely got carried away there
and I definitely put way too much on I
Do Love Drunk elephant but if you want
to have a less expensive option I know
there's a ton of less expensive retinols
that are out there while I'm kind of
letting that set into my skin I'm going
to put on a little bit of eye cream just
for consistency I'm using the same one I
used earlier this is the Claren Total
Eye
[Music]
Lift most nights I will self-tan my face
as you guys know I don't tan naturally I
I don't burn but I also don't tan like I
sit out in the sun for a good couple
hours and like nothing happens what I
like to do is I'll mix in some of my
face moisturizer this is the same one I
used earlier with a drop of the tan Luxe
face tanning drops I really really like
these tanning drops for the face they
don't break me out at all it's not like
they're sticky or anything and it gives
me a really nice
tan but I try to rubb in the product
upwards on my face cuz if you think
about it wrinkles are caused by dragging
down your skin so I don't know if this
does anything we're almost done guys I
promise I told you I don't do these 10
step routines
anymore I'm matured this last step is
for my girlies who are committed to
skincare you know it does take a bit of
effort and some nights I'm just like no
I don't want to do it basically I just
use any face oil right now I'm using
this one I've only used it a couple
times it's the Gau face oil really any
face oil though will work and I just
take a few drops of this and I
concentrate it on like my jawline neck
area I'm going in with the gach shaw I
mostly Focus just on this jaw area so I
do 10 swipes here 10 swipes
[Music]
here I've said this before and I'll say
it again I don't know if the gacha does
anything like truly does this do
anything does anyone have proof I like
to think it does so maybe let's just
pretend but that is everything that I do
for my skincare at night I hope you guys
liked this video I love skincare videos
I love makeup videos and it seems like
you guys like them too every once in a
while so let me know if you guys want
any specific makeup or skincare videos
I'll also make sure to link all these
products down below I just finished
filming but I wanted to say one thing
it's very normal to break out it's very
normal to have skin texture look right
here I have a breakout if you guys
didn't already see your skin isn't
supposed to be perfect like those
filters on Tik Tok I just wanted to say
that because it's like so unrealistic
skincare should be a form of self-love I
just wanted to say that love you guys
see you in my next video bye
[Music]
